title: View or edit product model
content:
This page explains how to view or edit a product model record.

View or edit product model

  1. Click  > Plan > Company.
  2. In the Companies dropdown, click Product Models.
  3. Click the name of the product model you want to view or edit. The product model record contains the following tabs.
    Tab Description
    General View and edit product model details. For more information, see the "General tab" section.
    Workflow View the workflow and current phase of the product model. The current phase of the product model is highlighted in blue in the workflow. 

    For information on the product model workflow and the procedure to change the phase, see the Product model workflow page.
    User options View, add, and delete user options for the product model. For more information, see the "User options tab" section.
    Default values

    Define default values for all the custom fields in the User options tab. For more information, see the "Default values" section.
    Rules Define business rules for the product model. For more information, see the "Rules tab" section.
    Modules View, add, and delete modules for the product model. For more information, see the "Modules tab" section.
    Versions View, add, and delete the versions for the product model. For more information, see the "Versions tab" section.
    Related knowledge

    View knowledge and news articles related to the product model. This tab is not available for product models of type Bundle and Category.
    Environments View all environments where the product instances related to the product model are deployed. This tab is not available for product models of type Bundle and Category.
    Sub product models View all sub-product models of the product model.
    Bundled products View bundled products. For more information, see the "Bundled products tab" section.
    Discussions View conversations relevant to the product model. For more information, see the Discussions page.
    History View changes to the product model record. For more information, see the History page
  4. Click the tab you want to view or edit.
  5. Edit as required.
  6. Click Save on the toolbar.

General tab

The General tab has the following sections:

  • Product model details
  • Identifiers
  • Sustainability
  • Attachments

Product model details

Field Description
Display label The display label for the product.
Model type

The model type of the product. The available options are:
Bundle: A collection of multiple products that are packaged together and offered as a single unit to the user.
Category: A classification or grouping of similar products.

Product: An individual product.
Publisher The company offering the product. 
Product type The type of the product. The available options are Hardware, Service, and Software.
Product name The name of the product.
Taxonomy
An additional product classification. This field can be used for additional business logic and to filter data based on the level where the product is managed.
The available options are:
  • Level 1 - Segment
  • Level 2 - Line of business
  • Level 3 - Product line
  • Level 4 - Portfolio name
  • Level 5 - Supported product 
  • Level 6 - SKU
Product line The specific product line to which the product belongs.
Parent model The parent model.
Release date The date when the product was first released.
Owner group The group responsible for the product support.
End of life date The date when the product will not be supported or available.
Owner The person responsible for the product support.
Description The description of the product.
Picture The product's image. For a software product, this can be the product logo or a screenshot.

Identifiers

Field Description
SKU number The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) number. It is a unique alphanumeric code assigned to each distinct product in inventory management. 
UNSPSC code The United Nations Standard Products and Services Code (UNSPSC). It is a global classification system used for categorizing products and services across industries and sectors.
Product Id The unique identifier for the product.
EAN number The European Article Number (EAN). It is a unique barcode symbology used to identify retail products at the point of sale. 
External reference The unique identifier or reference number used for mapping the product model record with external systems

Sustainability

Field Description
Location The location where the product was developed.
Product lifetime (years) The lifetime of the product.
Energy demand The energy required to produce a product, operate a software, or provide a service. 
Lifetime usage emissions The total amount of gas emissions generated over the product's lifespan or usage period.

The gas emissions generated during the production, manufacturing, and transportation of the product.
Recurring usage emissions The gas emissions that occur on a regular basis during use of the product or service.
Emission recurring period The frequency at which Recurring usage emissions are generated.
Total emissions The total amount of greenhouse gas emissions associated with a product or service.
Unit The unit of measurement for emissions. Example, Kilograms (kg) of carbon dioxide equivalent (CO2e)

Attachments

This section displays the attachments related to the company.

Add attachment

Your suite administrator defines an attachment allowlist in Suite Administration. You can only upload attachments with a file type in this allowlist. The attachment file name mustn't exceed 200 characters in length.

To add an attachment:

  1. Click Add attachment.
  2. Upload the attachment. This adds the attachment to the Attachments section.
  3. Repeat steps 1 and 2 to add more attachments.
  4. Click Save on the toolbar.

Delete attachment

  1. Click the delete icon    on the attachment you want to delete.
  2. Click OK in the Confirm Attachment Deletion dialog box.
  3. Repeat steps 1 and 2 for all the attachments you want to delete.
  4. Click Save on the toolbar.

Workflow tab

This tab displays the product model workflow. The current phase of the product model is highlighted in blue in the workflow. 

For information on the product model workflow and the procedure to change the phase, see Product model workflow.

User options tab

This tab displays user options for the product model. This tab is not available for product models of type Bundle and Category.

User options

Use the user options feature to add custom fields to the product model.

You can define the user options as individual fields, or you can classify the fields into different groups and sections if you need to manage multiple user options with different types.

After you add a group (Level 1) under a section (Level 1), you can further add a sub-section (Level 2) to the group (Level 1) and then add a sub-group (Level 2) to the sub-section (Level 2). You can define up to 3 levels of depth for sections and groups if required.

While creating a product instance of a specific product model, all custom fields defined for the product model will appear in the product instance form. These fields are also visible in the User options section in the General tab of the product instance record.

Add section

  1. Click New section to add a section.

  2. (Optional) Select a group where you want the section to appear. If you don't select any group, the section will be displayed as an individual section. The properties for each section are shown in the right pane.

    Property

    Description

    Display name

    The display name of the section in the Service Management user interface.

    You can either use plain text or you can add HTML anchor tags in the Display name.

    For example, you can specify a hyperlink in the Display name: <a href="www.MyURL.com">MyURL</a>. In this example, the hyperlink will be opened in the current tab. 

    Or, <a href="www.MyURL.com" target="_blank">MyURL</a>. In this example, the hyperlink will be opened in a new tab.

    Beside the HTML anchor tags, other types of HTML tags are also supported. See the list of allowed HTML tags in Service Management .

    Field size

    The size of the field in the Service Management user interface. Select Medium or Large. In the Service Portal, all fields are displayed as a fixed size, one field per line, regardless of the selected field size.

    Required

    Users must give this property a value when editing it from the user interface. This setting does not affect backend API calls.

    Help text

    Provide help text to give some details or hints of this user option. You can either use plain text as a description or you can add HTML anchor tags in the Help text.

    For example, you can specify a hyperlink in the Help text: <a href="www.MyURL.com">MyURL</a>. In this example, the hyperlink will be opened in the current tab.

    Or, <a href="www.MyURL.com" target="_blank">MyURL</a>. In this example, the hyperlink will be opened in a new tab.

    Beside the HTML anchor tags, other types of HTML tags are also supported. See the list of allowed HTML tags in Service Management .

    For an aggregated offering from a cloud service, some help text are aggregated from DND service design and you may edit the help text accordingly.
    The maximum length of Help text is 2000 characters.

  3. Edit the properties as required, and then click Save on the toolbar.

  4. Click the Move Up and Move down buttons on the toolbar to determine the order in which the whole section (including all sub-groups and sub-sections and fields under this section) should be displayed. The Move up and Move down buttons are disabled for the sections, groups, and fields aggregated from Service Design.

Add group

  1. Click New group to add a group.

  2. Select a section where you want the group to appear. The properties for each group are shown in the right pane.

    Property

    Description

    Display name

    The display name of the group in the Service Management user interface.

    You can either use plain text or you can add HTML anchor tags in the Display name.

    For example, you can specify a hyperlink in the Display name: <a href="www.MyURL.com">MyURL</a>. In this example, the hyperlink will be opened in the current tab. 

    Or, <a href="www.MyURL.com" target="_blank">MyURL</a>. In this example, the hyperlink will be opened in a new tab.

    Beside the HTML anchor tags, other types of HTML tags are also supported. See the list of allowed HTML tags in Service Management .

    Field size

    The size of the field in the Service Management user interface. Select Medium or Large. In the Service Portal, all fields are displayed as a fixed size, one field per line, regardless of the selected field size.

    Help text

    Provide help text to give some details or hints of this user option. You can either use plain text as a description or you can add HTML anchor tags in the Help text.

    For example, you can specify a hyperlink in the Help text: <a href="www.MyURL.com">MyURL</a>. In this example, the hyperlink will be opened in the current tab.

    Or, <a href="www.MyURL.com" target="_blank">MyURL</a>. In this example, the hyperlink will be opened in a new tab.

    Beside the HTML anchor tags, other types of HTML tags are also supported. See the list of allowed HTML tags in Service Management .

    For an aggregated offering from a cloud service, some help text are aggregated from DND service design and you may edit the help text accordingly.
    The maximum length of Help text is 2000 characters.

  3. Edit the properties as required, and then click Save on the toolbar.

  4. Click the Move Up and Move down buttons on the toolbar to determine the order in which the whole group (including all sub-sections and sub-groups and fields under this group) should be displayed. The Move up and Move down buttons are disabled for the sections, groups, and fields aggregated from Service Design.

Add field

  1. Click New field to add a field.

  2. (Optional) Select a group where you want the field to appear. If you don't select any group, the field will be displayed as an individual field. The properties for each field are shown in the right pane.

    Property

    Description

    Name

    The name of the user option. The name:

    • Must start with an upper case letter.

    • May contain alphanumeric characters only (A-Z, a-z, 0-9).

    • May not contain spaces.

    • Must end with _c. This suffix is added automatically. You don't need to enter it manually.

    Display name

    The display name of the field in the Service Management user interface.

    You can either use plain text or you can add HTML anchor tags in the Display name.

    For example, you can specify a hyperlink in the Display name: <a href="www.MyURL.com">MyURL</a>. In this example, the hyperlink will be opened in the current tab. 

    Or, <a href="www.MyURL.com" target="_blank">MyURL</a>. In this example, the hyperlink will be opened in a new tab.

    Beside the HTML anchor tags, other types of HTML tags are also supported. See the list of allowed HTML tags in Service Management .

    Field size

    The size of the field in the Service Management user interface. Select Medium or Large. In the Service Portal, all fields are displayed as a fixed size, one field per line, regardless of the selected field size.

    Required

    Users must give this property a value when editing it from the user interface. This setting does not affect backend API calls.

    Help text

    Provide help text to give some details or hints of this user option. You can either use plain text as a description or you can add HTML anchor tags in the Help text.

    For example, you can specify a hyperlink in the Help text: <a href="www.MyURL.com">MyURL</a>. In this example, the hyperlink will be opened in the current tab.

    Or, <a href="www.MyURL.com" target="_blank">MyURL</a>. In this example, the hyperlink will be opened in a new tab.

    Beside the HTML anchor tags, other types of HTML tags are also supported. See the list of allowed HTML tags in Service Management .

    For an aggregated offering from a cloud service, some help text are aggregated from DND service design and you may edit the help text accordingly.
    The maximum length of Help text is 2000 characters.

  3. Edit the properties as required, and then click Save on the toolbar. 

  4. Click Move Up or Move down on the toolbar to determine the display order of the new fields. The Move up and Move down buttons are disabled for the sections, groups, and fields aggregated from Service Design.

Delete section, group, or field

When you delete a section or a group, all sub-groups and sub-sections and fields under this section or group will also be deleted. You can't delete a section or a group or a field that's aggregated from Service Design.

To delete a section, group, or field:

  1. Click the section, group, or field you want to delete. The selected item is highlighted in gray.
  2. Click Delete.
  3. Click OK in the Delete Confirmation dialog box.
  4. Click Save on the toolbar.

Default values tab

This tab allows you to define the default values for all the custom fields in the User options tab. This tab is not available for product models of type Bundle and Category.

Define default value

  1. For each user option field, select one of the following options:
    • Simple Mode. Enter the default value in the text box, or for a list, select a value from the drop-down list.
    • Expression Language. Enter an Expression Language phrase that returns the default value. For a full list of Expression Language functions, see Expression Language functions and syntax.
      Click the Expression Language   button to toggle between these options. When the button is selected (blue), the field is in Expression Language mode. When it's not selected (white), the field is in Simple mode. 
  2. Click Save on the toolbar.

Rules tab

This tab allows you to define business rules within the product model. This tab is not available for product models of type Bundle and Category.

The rules run in the product instance records created for this product model. These business rules can be used to make a user option mandatory, hidden, or to control values displayed in the user option fields and any fields in the product instance based on the product model. You can define the rules to run in connection with one of the following process events:

Process event Description
Before change The rule is run before the data is updated.
After change The rule is run after the data is updated.
Rendering forms The rule is run when a form is opened.
After applying changes The rule is run after the change is committed.

In each process event, you can define the rule to run either before or after the general record business rules.

Add business rule

  1. Select the required process event and click one of the links to add a rule.
    • Click the button next to Add a rule to run before productinstance record rules to add a business rule that will run before the general record business rules in this process event.
    • Click the button next to Add a rule to run after productinstance record rules to add a business rule that will run after the general record business rules in this process event.
  2. Select a rule template and add a business rule. For more information, see How to add a business rule.
  3. When more than one business rule is defined for a process event, you can click in the left margin to display the arrow buttons which enable you to change the order of the rules or to move a rule from before the general record business rules to after or vice versa. Alternatively, you can drag and drop a rule to the desired location.
  4. Click  Save on the toolbar.

Edit, remove, or disable business rule

  1. Select the business rule.
    • To edit the rule, click the parameters and enter or select the required parameter value in the appropriate edit box.
    • To add or remove a condition, click Edit and select Add/Remove condition.
    • To add or edit a description of the rule, click Edit and select Add/Edit description. Enter your description in the text box.
    • To delete the rule, click Edit and select Remove rule.
    • To disable the rule, click Edit and select Disable rule. The rule remains in the process event, but isn't implemented.
    • To re-enable the rule, select Edit and select Enable rule.
  2. Click Save on the toolbar.

Modules tab

This tab displays the modules of the product model. This tab is not available for product models of type Bundle and Category.

Add module

  1. Click New.
  2. Specify the following details:
    Field Description
    Display label The display label for the module.
    Description The description of the module.
  3. Click SAVE. You can see the module record you created in the Modules tab and the Product Modules tab (Main menu > Plan > Company > Product Modules).

View or edit module details

  • Click the ID of the module to open the record.  For more information, see the View or edit module page.

Delete module

  1. Click anywhere on the module (except the ID) that you want to delete. The record is highlighted in gray.
  2. Click Delete.
  3. Click OK in the Confirm Delete dialog box.

Versions tab

This tab displays the versions of the product model. This tab is not available for product models of type Category.

Add version

  1. Click New.
  2. Specify the following details:
    Field Description
    Display label This field is auto-populated, combining the version name and number in the format:  Version name (version number).
    Version name The name of the version. 
    Version number The version number. 
    Type The type of the version. The available options are Major, Minor, and Patch.
    Parent version The parent version, if applicable.
    Maintenance start date The date from which the version maintenance begins.
    Maintenance end date The date on which the version maintenance ends.
    Description The description of the version.
  3. Click SAVE. You can see the version record you created in the Versions tab and the Product Versions tab(Main menu > Plan > Company > Product Versions).

View or edit version details

  • Click the ID of the version to open the record. For more information, see the View or edit version page.

Delete version

  1. Click anywhere on the version (except the ID) that you want to delete. The record is highlighted in gray.
  2. Click Delete.
  3. Click OK in the Confirm Delete dialog box.

Bundled products tab

This tab displays the individual products included in a bundle, these are reffered to as product bundle items. This tab is available only to product models of type Bundle.

Product bundle item

A product bundle item represents an individual product that is part of a bundle. It specifies: 

  • Product Model – The product added to the bundle.
  • Version (if applicable) – The version of the product included in the bundle.
  • Quantity – The number of units of the product in the bundle.

Add product bundle item

  1. Click New.
  2. Specify the following details:
    Field Description
    Display label The display name for the product bundle item.
    Parent model This field is auto-filled with the selected bundle.
    Bundle version The version of the bundle.
    Product item The product model you want to add to the bundle.
    Product version The specific version of the product to be included in the bundle.
    Quantity The number of units of the product (of the specified version) to include in the bundle.
    Description A description of the product bundle item.
  3. Click SAVE. You can see the new record you created in the Bundled products tab.

Delete product bundle item

  1. Click anywhere on the record (except the ID) that you want to delete. The record is highlighted in grey.
  2. Click Delete. 
  3. Click OK in the Confirm Delete dialog box.

View workflow and current phase of product bundle item

  1. Click the ID of the product bundle item.
  2. Click the Workflow tab. This displays the workflow, and the current phase is highlighted in blue.

Change phase of product bundle item

  1. Click the ID of the product bundle item. This directs you to the General tab
  2. Click the phase button   on the upper-right side of the page to change the phase to the next phase, or select the appropriate phase from the dropdown.
  3. Click Save.
